criteria: Understanding of Germ Types and Examples
descriptions: The student does not provide a definition for germs or the definition is completely inaccurate.
The student attempts to define germs, but the definition is very vague and contains significant inaccuracies.
The student provides a basic definition of germs but misses key components or includes minor inaccuracies.
The student provides a reasonably accurate definition of germs, covering most key aspects.
The student provides a comprehensive and accurate definition of germs, demonstrating a solid understanding.
The student provides an exceptionally clear, accurate, and thorough definition of germs, showing a deep understanding and potentially including relevant examples or context.
The student demonstrates no understanding of different types of germs (e.g., bacteria, viruses) or cannot provide any examples.
The student shows a limited awareness of different types of germs but struggles to name or differentiate them.
The student can name a few types of germs but has difficulty providing accurate examples or explaining their differences.
The student identifies several types of germs and provides some accurate examples, showing a basic understanding of their diversity.
The student clearly explains different types of germs with accurate examples, demonstrating a good understanding of their characteristics.
The student provides a detailed and nuanced explanation of various types of germs, including specific examples and their impact on health, demonstrating a comprehensive understanding.
